titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Brandenberg receipts 1977.473
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:10:04 +0000.

did.abstract: This collection contains William Brandenberg's receipts for water bills and other city taxes. William Brandenberg, a carriage maker, resided at 384 Hamilton Avenue in Brooklyn. His shop was located at 385 Hamilton Avenue.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); William Brandenberg receipts, 1977.473, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Brandenberg, a carriage maker, resided at 384 Hamilton Avenue in Brooklyn. His shop was located at 385 Hamilton Avenue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains William Brandenberg's receipts for water bills and other city taxes.
